newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Minas Gerais sets new deadline in Credireal sale.
newsitem.headline: Minas Gerais sets new deadline in Credireal sale.

text.p: The Brazilian state of Minas Gerais said it has set a new deadline for investors to pre-qualify for the upcoming auction of its bank Credireal, expected to take place late May.
The state government said in a published statement investors will be allowed to pre-qualify by April 18. Investors had been previously required to pre-qualify by April 7.

Minas Gerais state also decided to extend the pre-qualification period because Credireal's sell-off hinges on a Senate approval of a 350 million reais loan by federal mortgage bank Caixa Economica Federal (CEF), said a Credireal spokesman.
The loan would finance necessary adjustments prior to the bank's privatization.
The new deadline also will give more time for investors, including foreigners, to look at Credireal's sale process, the spokesman said.
He said that, after the takeover of troubled retail bank Banco Bamerindus by HSBC Holdings Plc, more foreign banks are likely to seek opportunities in Brazil's banking sector.
